Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Buenos dias, Erin.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Buenos dias, Miguel. [phone rings] Hello, Dunder-Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no. Solamente en espanol, por favor.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I believe that every man, woman, and child in this country should learn how to speak Spanish. They are our neighbors to the South, and this would be a healing thing for... for all of North America. And... I am going on vacation next week to Cancun.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Buenos dias, Jaime.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Buenos dias, Miguel. Como estas? Bien? Claro que si! Yo estoy fantastico. Que pasa?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ha ha! Buenos dias, Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Guten tag, Herr Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't understand why Michael is wasting his time with Spanish. I have it on very good authority that within 20 years, everyone will be speaking German. Or a Chinese-German hybrid.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: La telefona.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: El telefono.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael's having a hard time with the gender part of Spanish. So I told him to mark everything with the international symbol for gender. And, um... [holds up two blurred-out drawings of male and female genitalia] I should have been more specific.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Your office is full of genitalia.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [clears throat] Oh. Eso es lo que dice, el!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: "That's what he says?"

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Damn it. [knock on door] Ah, Angelo.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Angela. [Michael sticks post-it on Angela's forehead with female genitalia] Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yo soy Cancun.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [removes post-it, leaves] Uhh!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right, so I'll finish up on bulk pricing, and then you go into delivery guarantee.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know, maybe there's an opportunity for a joke there, like, um... like, [vaudeville delivery] "I just delivered a baby. They didn't offer me a guarantee."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, or maybe we don't even need that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can you smell the power of the Halperts? Power couple.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know what? I should be getting this client, Michael. My numbers are better than either of theirs.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I went with the people I thought would put the best face on the company.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If you want people to put the best face on something, why would you get two people who probably never cut the face off of anything in their lives?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [whispers] That's a good point.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This is our first joint sales pitch. I think we're gonna work really well together.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah I think we have complimentary strengths. We understand each other.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We have good give and take. [vaudeville delivery] I give, he takes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [whispering] I don't even know who you are anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [vaudeville delivery] Yee.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: Hi, uh, Donna Newton, here to see Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, hey, Miss Newton. Hi, I'm Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: Hi!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How are you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did somebody order a hooker over here?

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: [laughing] Oh, stop that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi. How are you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There's this woman I met a few weeks ago. Her name is Donna, the manager of Sid & Dexter's and, right now, we're in the midst of a passionate love affair. Um, no. But she is coming by today. Maybe to buy some printers, so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right here, we have the wonder twins, Jim and Pam Halpert. They will be assisting you today.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: You look exactly alike.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, no we're actually married. We're not brother and sister.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: I have a sense about these things.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: You have some ancestors in common... somewhere back.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I knew it. You should see their baby.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [explaining PowerPoint to Donna] So, yes, laser printers are more expensive. But they cost less to operate [knocking] So it's a tradeoff.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [barges in] Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hold on one second.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sorry to interrupt. Sorry to interrupt. Do you, Donna, by any chance shop at Victoria's Secret?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because I keep getting these magazines sent to me via the address of the woman who used to live in my condo before me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: None of this is time sensitive.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, yes, uh, the sale is on now through May.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, I have more of them.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: You would have weekly conference calls with executives in corporate. A two-week training program at the Yale school of management, obviously you would be high on the list for advancement opportunities.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Sounds all right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What is this?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Oh, this is "Print in All Colors," Sabre's minority executive training program.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It doesn't just sound a'ight, it sounds amazing.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I didn't say "a'ight."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How do I apply?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: You have to be a minority.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, glasses wearers. Cholera survivors. Geniuses. Non-organic family farmers. The list goes on and on. You want me to keep going?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Those don't really count. We're thinking more ethnic and racial minorities.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come here. Come here.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ten seconds ago, this guy was driving a forklift. Okay? Now all off a sudden he's Cinderella of the office. What are you guys thinking?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I like the sound of this. [looks at Dwight] Maybe one day I'll be sitting in Michael's chair. Wouldn't that be something?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: One minority from this branch is going to get into this program. Who would I refer? Hmm... the competent, hardworking one who does things his own way, or the malleable simpleton who can be bought for a few fashion magazines?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [on phone] This is the second time that you've sent me the wrong size. I mean, I know what a four feels like. I've been a four my whole life. You know what? You can go to Hell. All right? Thanks for nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, man. White people, right?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I don't know if she was white.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, you can kinda tell from the voice.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I bet you get pulled over by the cops a lot, just because of your race.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well, they say it's because of texting, but maybe you're right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I think you should consider applying for the executive minority training program.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Never thought of myself as an executive before.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know, 'cause you have no role models. How many Indian CEO's can you think of?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I can't think of any CEO's, any race.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You could be the Indian Bill Gates. You could be the Indian Ted Turner.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I could be the Indian Julia Roberts.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's not... she's... okay. Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I took the liberty to scan a few things earlier, and I want to show you... there we go! [Michael's picture pops up on the PowerPoint screen] Whoa, look at those vivid colors. Look at my eyes. Those are Shrek-green eyes. That is me again. I think this displays the crisp, dazzling white.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And that would be a display [image from a catalog of a man wearing only white boxers pops up] of the crisp, gorgeous black.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's subtle. That's how it works. I show her an image that turns her on. And then she looks at me, then back at me, then back at the image. Soon, she doesn't know what is me, what is the image. She just knows that she's turned on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is a place that I like to go to be alone with my thoughts. I've never taken anybody there before.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: Who took the photo?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: Oh. [Michael quickly advances PowerPoint show to last slide which is "SEX" in bold white letters on a black background and then exits the show quickly]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And that's it. That's me. That's who I am.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: [giggles] Not bad.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, thanks. [softly] You're not bad, either.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: Thank you. [Michael tries t kiss Donna, Donna clears throat] Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: Oh my God. [realizing Jim and Pam are looking through the conference room windows]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim! Could you come in here for a sec? What was that printer we were looking at?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in his office] You didn't see it, Pam. She was giving me all sorts of signals that she wanted me to make a move. Shortbread?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'll have one.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, maybe you shouldn't try to kiss people at work.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh really, Jim? What about Pam? And you did a heck of a lot more than kiss. Maybe this could be my Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. Well, all that is irrelevant.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe Michael has a point. I mean, if she was really that upset, she wouldn't still be here.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: Was it professional? No. But I work in the nightlife industry. I get hit on all the time. In my 20's it would have been annoying. In my late 20's, I find it really flattering.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look, I know that I screwed up in there. I know that I probably messed up your sale. I just want to go in and fix it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What if I back out and you finish the pitch with Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What was that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Just let him flirt with her. People meet each other all sorts of ways.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam, you know he's not gonna get anywhere, and he's gonna blow our sale.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Who cares? [Michael peeking at them through his office window] It's not that huge a sale.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, the Schwab guy told us to treat every sale like it was a huge sale.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Don't act like you understood anything that guy said. [pat's Jim's arm] Good luck, wingman. [salutes]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How as being a minority affected you?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well, there's a lot of pressure from my parents to settle down and marry an Indian guy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, good, and you resent this because...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Indian guys always wear their cell phones outside their pants. It's so dorky.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, no, no. That's not dorky. [Dwight wears his phone like that] Look, it's easily accessible. Boom, like this. 911, hello. Scranton Strangler's in the house. Inside the house.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Just put it in your pocket.

Quote.Speaker: Michael and Donna
Quote.Text: [indistinct chatter inside conference room]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [looking it] Look at that. She's totally flirting with him.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You don't know that. Some people can't help oozing sexuality.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: You ever notice you can ooze two things:

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: Is this... is this the best you can do right there?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, for that printer, yes. Unfortunately we don't have a lot of flexibility.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: Oh. Well, I guess I'm just used to the restaurant business, [removes sweater revealing her revealing top] where, if you're in charge, then you can always get discounts for the people that you like.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So maybe we could find a little wiggle room, right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe wee find some wiggle room?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't... I don't think so.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think we could. [Donna giggles]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I don't see how we could possibly sell these for that little without losing money. Delivery alone will cost...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, well sometimes... sometimes it makes financial sense to lose money, right? Like for tax purposes.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Actually, ran the numbers on this, and in this case, it makes more financial sense to gain money.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why don't you run them again?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What if she's just flirting with you to get a better price?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If she is, it's working.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, Michael, here's a trick. Ask her if she wants a mint. If she says "no," then she is not interested.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: She does not like him.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You can flirt with someone to get what you want and also be attracted to them. How do you think we got together?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: 'cause I stopped by your desk like 15 times a day.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I was after your money.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, the joke was on you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, it was.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [typing] Can you stop micromanaging? I know how to do this.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey... what are you guys doing?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: This girl was really rude to me at the mall. So I created a fake I.M. account from a hot guy at her high school, and now I'm trying to make her anorexic.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Tell her everyone in home room thinks she's fat.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, that is so good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know, we really should keep practicing for this interview.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, that's okay. Ryan coached me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ryan? What does he know?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It's easy... you just turn every question around on them. Do you think you're treated differently because of your race?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Would you ask that same question if I was white? We're so in.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: "We?"

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: When I become executive, I'm gonna make Ryan manager.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: And then the two of us are cleanin' house.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Kelly will be even worse than Darryl. If you'd have told me this morning that today I'd be creating a monster capable f my own destruction, I 'd have thought you were referring to the bull Mose and I are trying to reanimate.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So corporate approval of this contract is contingent upon buyer and seller...

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Operating blahdy blahdy blah. Boilerplate. Pound of fish. [Donna laughing] Just kidding. Do you like mints?

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I carry mints with me sometimes. You ever tried those?

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: Oh, I haven't tried those. No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They're good [Donna grabs mint]

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: You want one?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: It's like cool... "certified cool." I like how they say "certified." Like there's some consortium of... [Michael grabs the mint from Donna's hand with his mouth, Donna pulls her hand away] Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can't stop myself from kissing her.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, now you know how I feel sitting next to those M&M's all day.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, why don't you just move the M&M's?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well, why don't you shut up!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, guys, guys, guys. Just tell me it's not totally insane to try one more time.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It is totally insane.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael, he's right. You are turning into a stalker.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. What do you think?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I think it's over, man.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ehh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, some for, some against.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nobody's for.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Mihael
Quote.Text: What do you think?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um... I think it's really, really unlikely.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really unlikely. But I can't say that it's impossible.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm not saying she's in love with him. But she could have left a while ago. Most printer sales are done over the phone, Ms. Boob shirt.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm going with Pam's group.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael. Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, guys, guys, guys. Guys, just... thank you for talking. Wish me luck.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What sort of movie would Rudy have been if he had just stopped, given up, after two rejections? Would have been a lot shorter. Probably been a lot funnier. But it would have ultimately been a disappointment. I still would have seen it, but that's not... the point.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Kelly is disqualified!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You said the program is not open to Caucasians. Well... anthropologically, she is Indian. Indians migrated from the caucuses region of Europe. Therefore, technically, she is Caucasian. You're welcome, America.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yeah, but she's not white, though.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, obviously, she is brownish. But come on, I mean, Darryl is far more ethnic.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Darryl withdrew his application. He said the Yale program interfered with his softball league, you know? He's gone.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I got my whole life to be a minority executive. I only have about a year left in these knees, though.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Kelly is the only applicant.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yeah, unless somebody else applies today.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Namaste.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, dear God. Okay. Don't make any decisions just yet. Okay? I'll be right back.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: That's very nice. [referring to Kelly's bindi] I never noticed that before.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Sometimes my bangs cover it.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yeah. I don't want to be offensive but, uh... may I ask you what that means?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I do find that offensive, actually.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We should have your contract done by Thursday.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: Oh, great. Great, I will look out for that stuff, then.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: And, um... you know I just wanted to say it was really... really nice to do business with you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah it was nice to do business with you, too.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: Thank you. Did I... get everything?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know. I think so.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: Yeah, I think so.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [whispers] Okay. So... Oh, Donna?

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: Yeah? Do you need validation? We don't... we don't validate.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: No, it's just in the lot, so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you so much.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: You're welcome. [they hug] You're... welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm. [Donna giggles]

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [follows her out of office] Ahem. So, um... okay, if you have... if there's any other questions that you have...

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: I don't have, uh, any other questions. [blind clanking as she leans against door to prevent from Michael kissing her] I'm just gonna... make my way down to...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. All right. Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: Bye-bye!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And have a good elevator ride.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, what's that out there?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael, how did it go? [Michael goes in his office and closes door]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How would one of you feel if I told you I could put you on a fast track to an executive position at this company?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Holy cow. I'd be so happy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I wasn't talking to you, pale-face.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I know. I meant I'd be happy for them.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What I'm offering is a ticket on a bullet train straight to middle management.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Dwight, I know these programs. "Every color is important because, together, we make a rainbow."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'll slap you in the face with a rainbow.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Mm!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Speaking of rainbows, Oscar... you are kind of a double minority. Gay. So we at Sabre could really benefit from your perspective.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Dwight, we know Kelly applied. We're not gonna cross her. No matter how good the program is.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can protect you from Kelly. [Erin stifles laugh] Will you get out of here? Seriously. [Erin turns and leaves kitchen]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: For hobbies, um, yoga, belly dancing, snake charming. Beds of nails. I like lying on them.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Whoa, whoa. Whoa, whoa, whoa! This is Hide Toshi Hasagawa. He would like to apply for the Sabre minority executive training program "print in all colors" initiative.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Dwight:

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Michael. [Michael is sitting on couch outside his office] How you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know. I don't know. Can't really trust my feelings anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know what, Michael? For what it's worth... I was wrong, too. I thought she was interested in you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She suckered you too.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Was it the cleavage?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, and the shoulder cutouts.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael, you know, it's easy to get fooled. Bob's warehouse guys flirt with me all the time. It... it's mostly harmless. Usually I don't let it go too far.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know, when I tore my scrote, I was, uh... I was seeing this really hot urologist about it, and thought she was into me. But now I think she was just doing a bunch of stuff to bill my HMO. You know, she's touching around down there. It's easy to get confused.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Michael, I think Donna left this here. Should I put it in the lost and found for 14 days and then I can take it home?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: God. She left this here?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Maybe she wants me to return this to her at her work.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. This could be a signal. People don't just take barrettes off.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's not a signal. It's just a coincidence. No, it's not even a coincidence. It's just something that happened.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [hold up barrette] Well...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: She doesn't want you to return the barrette. She's not interested in you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I know. I know.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know. You're right. Thank you. Thanks everybody. [waves, returns to his office, clears throat, turns around and runs out of office]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael! [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [runs down to parking lot, sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: [still in parking lot sitting in her car] Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. You're still here. I have your baguette.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Everyone, it is my pleasure to announce our newest member of the Sabre minority executive training program. Kelly Rajnigandha Kapoor. [clapping] All right.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: They're going to be pretty pleased in Tallahassee that I snagged an Indian for the program. She'll be the first. The program's mostly black. It's almost too black. That didn't sound right.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [puts a bindi on Erin's forehead] And the best part is is that I get a business stipend to buy all new clothes. So you can totally buy any of my old clothes that I'm not gonna need anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, my God, thank you so much. I love that denim jumpsuit you have. How much?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh. Actually I was thinking about clothes that I was just gonna give to Goodwill anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, kiddo. Congratulations are in order. You deserve it. [Dwight extends his hand, but Kelly hugs him]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Thank you, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I'll never forget everything that you've done for me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Gosh. He he.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Because I never forget anything.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just once, I would like to be a puppet master and have nothing go wrong. Is that too much to ask?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? Everybody told me that you weren't interested. Everybody. And I didn't believe 'em. And they were right. So... there's your barrette.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: No, y-you were... right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who?

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: You were right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: About what?

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: You were right. [Michael leans into Donna's car to kiss her and they kiss passionately] I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no. No.

Quote.Speaker: Donna
Quote.Text: I'm sor...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No... [they kiss again]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [returns to office] What happened?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Kelly got into the minority training program.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?! Oh, that's great. That's such good news. I did it! [all look at him] I kissed. We kissed.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Ooh.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I'm serious. It... this happened. I went down to the parking lot and I was... I returned her barrette [holds up barrette] We ki... We did. Okay. We did. We did.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? It doesn't matter. Because I know it happened. And that is all that counts. [shouts] I did do it!
